original_title: Three Days in June: The Story of the D-Day Forecast
overview: For a few tense days in June 1944, the success of the greatest military invasion the world had ever seen depended on weather readings taken by Maureen Sweeney at the remote Blacksod weather station on Ireland’s west coast. Maureen’s readings were the first to point out an impending storm which led to the postponement of the invasion.
title: Three Days in June: The Story of the D-Day Forecast
